website_summaries.verdict: The Sennheiser Momentum On-Ear may not fully match the larger Momentum's excellent sonics, but it gets you 80 percent of the way there.
pros: The Sennheiser Momentum On-Ear is a very good sounding on-ear headphone that has a eye-catching modern retro design, is well-built, and comes with a nice carrying case and a second headphone cable with an Apple-friendly integrated remote and microphone for making cell-phone calls
cons: Headphones are fairly compact but don't fold up or fold flat
may not be quite comfortable enough for some users

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable headphone
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound very good plenty of solid bottom without getting muddy. Nice smooth highs. Build quality is very good. Comfort is good for an hour or two no problem. I will pop the bow of my glasses above the cups for extended wearing. These don't fold flat for travel, But the fact that these don't isolate very well means I'm not likely to travel with them anyway. Beyerdynamic DTX501p are perfect for that use. I have never tried the Momentum over ears so can't compare these to them, But am happy especially for $78, this was a no brainer. Watch for dramatic price differences between the different colors I saved $20 with the pink ones.
customer_reviews.author: TMB

customer_reviews.title: 5 years later and still working strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones 5 years ago when I was studying for my medical board exams. Over the last 5 years they have held up incredibly well and are still my favorite pair of headphones. I have used them constantly over the years and they still work the same as the first day I opened it out of the box. The headphones are incredibly durable and I have not regretted my purchase since
customer_reviews.author: Kimber1y

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought 'em!
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones! These guys are very comfortable, stay put on my head, even when working, (construction, by myself), and running. The sound quality is outstanding. They have good bass response, but don't expect a Beats style headphone, they are not pumped up bass, they play what they are given and sound good doing it. The controls for the iPhone work good, not quite as easy to press as the standard iPhone headphones, but all of the same features are there, (I haven't tested the microphone quality in a phone call yet, but speech to text worked fine. They come with two cords, one with the iPhone controlling switch, and one without. I recommend these headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Love these ivory headphones by Sennheiser
customer_reviews.text: I Love these beautiful headphones I only wish I had ordered the momentum 2.0 instead. Some complained of the fit being tight but I think they're perfect snug enough not to slide off while walking but still very comfortable to wear for a couple hours or more. They have soft ear cushions of alcantara stainless steel thin bands that the ear covers slide up and down on and a leather headband. They come with a case and a nylon bag and 2 wires one with iPhone controls which work great with my iPad, mac, iPhone and windows phone. The sound is wonderful! I have the ivory ones and I adore the look of them as well as there output
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pair of headphones. I have purchased many headphones in the past looking for the combination of sound-quality, portability, and durabiltiy. These Sennheisers sound great, they are well-made, and they have many features of a high-end headphone. The headphones come with two removable cables - one for standard listening, and another with a built-in microphone for making calls. There is also a nice case included. I love the various colors available, and I have recommended this product to many of my friends that are looking for great headphones at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: jazzykitty

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are awesome. Authentic, comes with a carrying case and a replacement, non-mic cord. I had to switch to the non-mic cord because the cord with the mic broke on me after a month of use and is ~$40 to replace (just the cord). You have to use a special Sennheiser cord since it has a nib at the end that twists and secures the cord to the headset. I bought this when it was on sale for $75 and I use them every day. Sound quality is great, I do want to upgrade to the newer model, since those fold and are easier for carrying (this one is kind of bulky) but until then, these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: M. S.

customer_reviews.title: Meh at best
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these since I got them at more than 50% off from Amazon. I kept telling myself this was a steal but after using them daily for the past year I've given up. They were originally $200 headphones that are just okay. I have a pair of $40 Koss Portapro headphones that have better sound separation, bass response and clarity in general. After a year the psuedo leather as started to split and these things only sound good when turned up really loud and even then they're only okay. They're good enough to keep but not good enough to recommend when there are better choices out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, clean-sounding headphone
customer_reviews.text: Been using these headphones for over a year now and still love them. The sound quality is fantastic and to my ears give a very flat/even sound profile. No over the top bass modifiers, just a clean realistic sound. I love the modern style and the build quality is fantastic. I really appreciate the fact that you can easy replace the headphone cord, because it plugs into the bottom of one of the ears, since that is usually the component that fails first on any headphone I've owned. Comes with a convenient soft carrying case and and extra cord as well. Highly recommend for an over the ear headphone.
customer_reviews.author: ZT

customer_reviews.title: Great media player headset, fantastic quality sound.
customer_reviews.text: While I got these refurbished, they are incredible quality and the audio is just amazing. I purchased these as my computer headset wasn't cutting it anymore, snaps and pops - mic cutting out - audio controller went bad. However, they aren't really good for at-computer use so much, which was my error. However, for media or iPod or Audiobooks off of a small device, these are amazing. Great bass, good high notes, mid-range more than acceptable. I'm not an audiophile, but the difference between these headphones and some earbuds was noticeable even to my deaf ears, so it should satisfy any but the most tone-deaf people out there.
customer_reviews.author: Lanessar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Wear and Listen With
customer_reviews.text: I am prompted to write this review after a bad experience with the Ghostek Rapture Series Wireless Bluetooth Headphones Headset that beeps every 30 seconds to a minute and says it is connecting (while connected to my iPhone 8+) at least on every song. Compared to the Ghostek, this Sennheiser Momentum On-Ear Headphone - Red has the same sound quality but is lighter, fit better on my ears, and are not as bulky. I find these relatively inconspicuous, comfortable to wear, and give me the sound quality I want.
customer_reviews.author: Conspicuous ConsumerTop Contributor: Jigsaw Puzzles

customer_reviews.title: Killer Headphones.
customer_reviews.text: This product kicks some serious butt. I wanted a headphone I can work out with in the gym, I gave beats a look the frankly the sound is HORRIBLE, think people are buying them for the name only, big mistake. Sennheiser is a genius company for audiophiles, these headphones have a dynamic range that most headsets cannot even touch, kick ass bass to rockout on and crystal clear highs. They are light, very sturdy with a metal headband to keep your tunes in place during the workout. They come with two cords, one with audio controls (very handy) and one with just the wire, no coltrol. Good price, great product, great sound. GET IT!
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. These are my first pair of good headphones. I wanted something that I could wear around the house and listen to music without bothering my wife. I also wanted something that was a little more grown up than most of the other brands out there. Listening to some of my favorite songs with these headphones I discovered things I had never heard before. I listen to a variety of music, from Classical to Rock, and they handled all of it. Being on ear headphones they can become uncomfortable after wearing them for several hours, but I've found that if I adjust them every thirty minutes or so the uncomfortableness can be mostly eliminated.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is the "Baby Brother" of the full sized Momentum. They do look alike, but the On Ear Headphone does not have the fit or finish of its big brother. This headphone started with a price of around $250.00, but the price quickly settled to under $150.00. Don't let the list price fool you, this is a sub-$200.00, headphone. Having said all that, I love the sound of this headphone. It has a balanced sound and works great with iDevices. The fit and finish is very good and the isolation is more than adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe how good these headphones sound.  I am in love.
customer_reviews.text: I have not the words to do these justice. I can't believe how good these headphones sound. I am in love. I have a fair bit of audio experience but generally poopoo headphones as I prefer to be surrounded by the sound. A colleague convinced me to buy these Momentums and I have Zero regrets. The sounds is fantastic. Not over based like so many things are these days. Jazz, classical, Salsa, Timba everything sounds amazing, crisp clear with each instrument definied on these. They are on ear, rather then over. If I listen to these all day my ear lobes are a bit sore from being squished by these all day.
customer_reviews.author: Candy Lover

customer_reviews.title: It is nice that they come with a replacement cord
customer_reviews.text: I had these and gave them away. I'm not a big person but these were too tight for my head. I tried stretching the metal band out, but after two hours i couldn't deal with it. Maybe it doesn't help that i wear glasses and sometimes my industrial ear ring with them. It is nice that they come with a replacement cord, but the accompanying case really needs a clasp or something to strap onto your bag.
customer_reviews.author: F

customer_reviews.title: On ear headphone
customer_reviews.text: Got the headphone,have been using only for few days. Sound quality is really good. Product quality seems really bold. The reason I am giving 3 stars is its too tight for my head. My head size isn't big at all. after wearing 20 minutes my ear hurts and it even leaves red mark on my ears. I am not really surprised to get a headache after 1-2 hours. I am not a complainer and I really don't like to return things. I researched a lot how to make it comfortable for my ears. People said I can stretch a little bit before I wear it, I tried, but doesn't seem really helpful. I am thinking to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones. Very comfortable for on-ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones. Very comfortable for on-ear headphones. Hi-fi audio without the bass distortion common in popular headphones such as Beats. Over all, highly satisfied, High quality, stylish, and affordable. Edit -1 star. The wire connecting the two ear pieces is a bit flismy. The sharp edges wore through the rubber coating and broke the wire. Also, the cable wore out after led than a year of moderate desk use and minimal mobile use. That being said. The 2 year warenty service was excellent. The product was repaired and returned very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend; you can't do better for the money.
customer_reviews.text: They are a little tight on my head, but the sound is so amazing that I have totally replaced my Bose with these at work. I listen to music with a lot of bass, and these headphones are the best I've heard. Don't waste money on Beats or even on more expensive Sennheisers- these are the ones you want. Having the volume adjust on the cord is also more helpful than I'd thought.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding headphones at a price that makes these simply a must-buy for any audiophile.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are, hands down, the best personal headphones for everyday use I've ever listened to. The sound quality is quite literally unbeatable for the price. The frequency response range of 17hz-23khz makes for, while not the loudest bass amplifier you'll hear in a headphone, it's the most responsive and crystal clear overall audio driver I've ever listened to. It's not that the bass driver is quiet, either, it's just not quite as loud as other brands, but it more than makes up for it with the unmatched depth of bass it's providing (17hz is very low), paired with the clarity of high-frequencies.
customer_reviews.author: Matt D.

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: These hurt my ears -- A LOT. I read all the reviews about this before I bought these, thinking they were overstating the severity of the issue. No - they legit hurt pretty bad. I have glasses, so maybe that also contributed. The sound was good- superior, even, but definitely leaked out. I got these to listen to music at my cubicle, but the sound kept leaking out to my neighbors. I could've dealt with that if the whole ear pain thing hadn't been a factor. I ended up sending these back and opting for an over the ear model that I'm very pleased with.
customer_reviews.author: Kacie

customer_reviews.title: Unreal sound quality. Contemporary retro look.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. They look great and sound even better. In a headphone era dominated by hideous BOSE, Apple earbuds (they have their place) and Beats by Dre (ugh.), its nice to find a quality headphone that have good sound and good style. Really like the ivory/brown color combo, looks like old aviation headphones or radio operator.
customer_reviews.author: MinimalistApproach

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are a dream. I'm not a serious audiophile, but I know good sound when I hear it and these headphones have got it. Confident, but not overpowering bass response; nice, crisp treble; plenty of volume. These are the first headphones I've owned that really delivered for me on "separation", really hearing those instruments clearly and distinctly, to the extent I'm hearing additional details in songs I've known for a long time. The high resolution here has spoiled me for life. They're also very good looking headphones, somewhat retro from a distance but handsome up close. A little snug but the ear pads are like little pillows. If you've read this far, you should probably just get them.
customer_reviews.author: Hieronymous D

customer_reviews.title: Tight, 2nd hand noise, uncomfortable, sound quality average
customer_reviews.text: I saw these recommended via reddit. I was upgrading from the Bose ioe2's however I ending up returning these headphones. The primary reason was due to the discomfort is was feeling after about fifteen minutes of listening. It was as if they were too snug. Also there was a much larger amount of noise pollution compared to the Bose headphones. The sound quality was equal to that of the iOE2's, but they weren't as soft and form-fitting as what I was accustomed to. I'm debating trying the over the ear momentums, but will try to find someone else's to try on before rolling the dice again. I suggest you do the same.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pulfer

customer_reviews.title: Where portability, great looks, very good sound and strong build meet each other.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, great look, great build, great price, they were on innerfidelity's wall of fame and I love them. The highs and lows are quite good though the mids are slightly recessed not a big problem. Good sound stage and super comfortable, made with high quality materials.Sound isolation is good enough or in crowds.For a closed back set of cans that are easy to push with an iPod or any other MP3 player these are perfect. I own a pair of akg 460's, akg 181's, akg 240's, akg 44's and skull candy navigators. I used to own a couple pairs of bose. These so far are my favorite set cans out of all of those.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Vokits

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This pair of headphones gives you a good experience while listening to music, watching movies etc.. and I really love that about it. However it gets extremely uncomfortable after wearing it for more than 30 minutes. I have to actually take them out after a while because it hurts my ears quite a lot. Also, the sound coming from the headphones can be heard very easily if someone is sitting next to you so it might not be a good heaphone to use while travelling. Overall, it does produce sounds that hold great quality, however as i said.. the comfort is a real issue. Other than that, I also think its a bit too pricy for what its really offering..
customer_reviews.author: Skyman

customer_reviews.title: Glad I spent the extra money.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for quite a while now, was really hesitant to post a review until I used them a while. I was worried about the cords breaking as they dont have any support at the point they go into the phones. well, the sound awesome, look great, and have had not one issue. I love the mic it works perfectly with my android. Can't think of anything bad or negative to say about these, I use them daily.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for a small amount of money
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones! This is my second pair. I have one at work and bought these to use at home for night time TV and movie viewing. At work I listen to music either on my iPod, my Sandisk, or the computer. I have a few Linn Records Studio Master files and I listen to those from the computer. The Sandisk has Flac files and the iPod has either AAC or mp3. These headphones used to be over $200 when they came out. I seem to like them a little better than my Grado SR125s which went for $150 quite a few years ago.
customer_reviews.author: jrk4251

customer_reviews.title: I would marry these headphones if I could
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these headphones. They sound amazing and are gorgeous. Well made and very detailed. The cord can be replaced by a regular cord, without the iPhone controls. This is useful when using them for monitoring, or recording, as portable recorder (Zoom) would not pick up the headphones at least the play button is pressed all the time. Also if the cord gets damaged it can be replaced without losing the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: Look for a better value
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. I bought these based on the brand reputation. They sound good, but not great. I was expecting a bit better sound quality. I work in audio production, I have studio grade headphones on all the time. So maybe I've been spoiled. These are uncomfortable after a while. One of the ear padding bits popped off and was frustating to put back on. I don't fully regret the purchase, but would only consider possibly buying again if they were cheaper. Not great value.
customer_reviews.author: Jpoe.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Didn't Pay Full Price
customer_reviews.text: The good news: Comfortable. Comes with case and extra cord. Nice looking. The bad news: Needs some volume for good sound. Frequency response is okay but clips on the high end. Compared to my older Grado 80's they were supposed to replace they are a disappointment. The cord is incredibly thin and looks like it is easily damaged. My Grado 80"s will be getting new ear pads and these are going to the drum kit.
customer_reviews.author: BMan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price tag!
customer_reviews.text: First off, i always said id never spend a lot of money on headphones. One day i decided to step it up and after much research chose these and i have zero regrets. Only two downsides to these. 1) if you wear glasses they might get uncomfortable after long use. However, they are very adjustable so you can make it work 2) sound leak is pretty bad. I like my music loud and if listening at >half volume someone next to you in a relatively quiet room would hear it all. This headphone over-delivers in every other category so suffice to say if those are the two flaws ill have to live with i can do that
customer_reviews.author: Tc

customer_reviews.title: LITTLE ONES THAT CARRY A MIGHTY SOUND
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE HEADPHONES THEY ARE SO LIGHT AND THE CUPS SO COMFY I LISTEN TO LOTS OF EUROPEAN ESPECIALLY GERMAN INDUSTRIAL AND GOTH MUSIC AND THESE LITTLE GUYS SOUND GREAT THE BASE IF STRONG THE SNAP OF THE SNARE IS AMAZING FAST THE MIDS ARE GOOD TO EXCELLENT AND THE HIGH END IS DETAILED ONE THING IT TAKES ABOUT A WEEK TO BREAK THEM IN I DON'T KNOW IF THATS SENNHEISER OR JUST THESE PHONES BUT I WAS PATIENT AND IT PAID OFF BIG TIME THESE ARE WORTH AMAZON'S ASKING PRICES FOR SURE
customer_reviews.author: lillian perel

customer_reviews.title: Good style, good build, poor sound
customer_reviews.text: I don't consider myself an audiophile and never thought of myself as very discerning when it comes to headphone/earbud sound quality but, man, am I disappointed in these headphones. The V sound signature (emphasis on bass and the highest parts of sound) leads to an unclear muddled sound. Just inpleasant. I was attracted to these headphones because of its retromodern style, positive reviews and relatively low price (on sale for $84 at time of this review). I wish I would have heeded the warnings about the V sound signature and gone with something else instead.
customer_reviews.author: sweetie

customer_reviews.title: Fun headphone, good blend of audiophile and consumer appeal
customer_reviews.text: My other go to on ears are Audio Technica ESW 9s. Not sure these will supplant those, but the sound signature of these will definitely appeal more for more upfront, fun music. Low end is a little much for my tastes, but it is easily adjusted with an amp when necessary. FWIW I have a pretty big head and find no comfort issues with these. These are a good blend of Sennheiser quality and curb appeal to those new to higher end headphones. Certainly better than pretty much any Beats model, and a good "stylish" alternative to the P3/P5.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Bummer Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my daughter and one side broke within days (no sound). We'd already thrown out the box and didn't get additional warranty. I completely forgot about them but I just found the broken brand new headphones and I'm irked all over again. She is not hard on headphones -- in the past they've lasted years -- and her replacement (a different brand) is alive and kicking.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth

customer_reviews.title: Luxurious but snug
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love these headphones. I love the looks and the sound but it is extremely snug on the ears. These look luxurious and far more expensive than the price. The sound is great...the best so far of all the headphones I have tried that were b/w $100 - $200 but the comfort of wearing them for a prolonged time is the only negative. These are snug on the ears and my head is on the smallish side...I felt like I was loosing circulation in my ears after about 20 minutes of use. I ended up giving them to my 8 year old to use and it fits her head perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: C.Hart

customer_reviews.title: Great quality with metal headband and quality ear muffs
customer_reviews.text: First impression: Great quality with metal headband and quality ear muffs. Ear muffs are Smaller than I expected but still seal well on top of my ears and shut out outside noises well even without enclosing my entire ear. Sound is incredible- crisp and clear with very good full sound including great bass. Zipped cushioned case and soft sack for travel protection. Bought them for children as a hopefully better quality alternative to Beats and now I want to take them back for myself.
customer_reviews.author: snippit

customer_reviews.title: they actually sound pretty good. They do leak a bit of sound
customer_reviews.text: I am finding these are very picky with the source I play through - the only headphone I own with this issue. Playing through my Fiio e17k, they sound hollow. Plugged into my Note 5, they actually sound pretty good. They do leak a bit of sound, but not too bad. I have a medium sized head and they can get uncomfortable after about an hour of listening. These are well made and look fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: serkman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy used!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great but I would not recommend buying these second hand. The earpiece plastic disintegrated on both sides within 3 months of each other. I had them for a while but wanted to post this review for anyone who was thinking of buying them used.
customer_reviews.author: m.fur

customer_reviews.title: Terrible cable/connection on two different units
customer_reviews.text: The headphones sounds great WHEN the connection is working. The sound started breaking up on my first pair right out of the box. Every step I took would make the sound crackle as it failed to hold a good connection. I ordered a second pair (which Amazon overnighted for me, great customer service as always), and now after two weeks I'm having the same exact problem. When the connection was clear, they sound awesome. But how can headphones at this price point have such poor cabling? I'm going back to Klipsch. I can not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Great deal when on sale
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality for casual listening. It's a Sennheiser, so that's no surprise. Works smoothly with my iphone, but people say they can't hear me well unless I hold the remote still. Clamping force was a bit too much in the beginning, but it got loose after a few days of use. Padding is nice and soft. Build quality is good overall, except the cable which feels kind of cheapish. If I paid the original price, i.e. more than $200 , I'd give it 3 stars. But for $69 (green was the cheapest among all colors when I ordered) this was the best deal among the on-ear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: bradd

customer_reviews.title: excellent sound, 1/3 the price I paid
customer_reviews.text: when I first purchased these headphones, they were $300. Now, at $100, they are a steal! I use them everywhere when I want great sound and the suede material on your ears is comfortable and as they age, gets even more comfortable. for the price, I cannot recommend these anymore!
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but not that comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These look excellent and you get great sound but unless you have very small ears they feel uncomfortable to wear after only 10 minutes or 15 minutes and let's face it, that's not that very useful. You can try to convince yourself that you can actually hear the difference between good headphones and great headphones but the fact is that the awesome sound quality starts to fade into the background as soon as your ears start getting sore.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Good headpones
customer_reviews.text: Bought these on a black friday sale and was happy with the purchase. Good quality sound and very little leakage for an on ear headphone. The wire is sturdy (as far as I can tell) and the headphones in general are durable. The only complaint I have is that they tend to hurt my ears when I've worn them for too long (also noted by a friend with the same headphones) and sometimes my hair gets caught in the frame. Good product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Sounding off
customer_reviews.text: No need to go too deep on reviews as many have covered the necessary points. Pros: Comfort, price, sound quality, looks, functionality, build quality Cons: None These are Over the ear so some ambient noise gets in (a plus for me since I like to know my surroundings) The brown color is striking enough, yet not too bold that it clashes with more conservative clothing. Bend the metal to fit your head perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Rob D

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser Quality Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Sennheiser Momentum On-Ear Headphones are great for people who want good frequency response and power at an affordable price. These headphones get loud without sacrificing clarity if you need them to. They are very comfortable to me and I have sensitive ears. They are very solid feeling and they are made well. I listen to European Death Metal, and the headphones have not disappointed me yet. For the price, these are probably among the best you can find. I love the colour options and the design (finally a pair that don't try to copy Beats). Sennheiser is a very good brand, I have had good experiences with these and the HD 219s.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: In love with these headphones
customer_reviews.text: In love with these headphones! The sounds are so crisp and clear. My musical experience has been taken another level. I am actually happy that they do not provide noise isolation because a lot of the times when I am listening to music people try to talk to me and I can't hear them but in this case I can actually kind of hear so I don't end up completely ignoring people and get stuck in my own little world in public. Although if I did want to be stuck in my own world I still could by going somewhere quiet or playing the music louder. Its beautiful too.
customer_reviews.author: Yan

customer_reviews.title: Beats Don't Have to Be Bass Heavy
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend loves these. We are both anti-Beats people and fans of quality headphone brands like Shure (earbuds), Audio-Technica, and Sennheiser. While neither of us are quite up to Audeze standards just yet, these Momentums are an affordable, clean sounding, semi-portable pair of headphones that have the ability to be upgraded (slightly) by changing the cable. The price to performance ratio is very favorable with these cans.
customer_reviews.author: AMG77

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, soft ear pieces, beautiful packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound quality. They were a little bigger than I expected. Very nice, soft, suede-like, box shaped carrying case. Although, the carrying case is too large to fit in my purse or briefcase so I normally carry them in the soft draw string case that also came with it. The ear pieces are also soft and suede-like. There is no sound cancelling whatsoever, so if in a noisy area expect to hear outside sounds (unless your music is turned right up!). There are in-line controls and you can use these to speak on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica W.

customer_reviews.title: The Sennheiser Momentum on-ears handle all musical genres from wonderfully to competently
customer_reviews.text: The Sennheiser Momentum on-ears handle all musical genres from wonderfully to competently. They scale well, depending on your gear. Driven by an iPhone, the bass is a touch big, but still tasteful. With a more powerful source, the bass tames and gives you a truly, for lack of better word, "delicious" sound signature. The fit is quite comfortable. I wear a medium-sized hat. At the current prices, they are a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Analog

customer_reviews.title: Absolute BEST bang for your buck! 5 stars et eternum
customer_reviews.text: I routinely recommend & purchase for friends!!!! Sound quality far superior to any BEATS, and for a fraction of their ignorantly bloated price. Only negatives to be mentioned is the remote only works with iOS devices, & no 3.5mm low-profile angled plug. Needed a replacement cable after 2 years due to this, of which are easily found here on Amazon! Sennheiser's Amazon shop also sells a cable for these with Android remote functionality, & a 3.5mm low-profile angled plug; but it's a crop shoot whether it will work on your Android device(though they are guaranteed compatible with all Samsung devices such as the ever popular Galaxy & Note). Great set of cans that truly do get better with age!!! PEACE
customer_reviews.author: Courtland K.

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: Excelent product. These headphones offer fantastic sound quality for the price. They look great and come in a handy case. Altough they don't bend like most on ear headphones I've seen they can be carried without much trouble in a backpack inside the bag that comes included. They apply a fair amount of pressure to the ears but this can be adjusted at will by bending the metal frame. Once you get used to wearing them they are very confortable. You can feel it's a quality product, my only complain it's that the in-line controls work exclusievly with apple products. All you can do with an android phone is use the middle button and microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: I didn't know how bad my prior headphones were until I got these ones
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know how bad my prior headphones were until I got these ones. At first they were a bit tight on, and hurt my ears if I wore them for more than an hour or so. But with time, they really loosened up. The sound quality is fantastic, and I love the style. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Paulina Perepelkin

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these headphones! They're leaps beyond Beats, and certainly worthy of the price-tag. They epitomize clarity & depth - clear highs with mellow mids and deep bass. These are perfect for today's digital media, and work well with my Samsung Galaxy S5. One caveat - the controls won't forward/rewind music on Android devices, but seem to work with Apple iPod.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C.

customer_reviews.title: They are relatively comfortable, although not for listening sessions more than probably ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are decent. They are relatively comfortable, although not for listening sessions more than probably 3-4 hrs. They can fit basically any size head due to having a metal headband that can be bent as needed. The detachable cable is nice. The sound however is only okay. It feels pretty empty in the mid-range and honestly despite people saying it has a bass bias, it seems pretty weak in the lower ranges as well. They still sound pretty good, but I wasn't blown away by any means. The other interesting thing is that when listening at very low volumes, the left side becomes extremely faint (probably 1/3 of what the right side is at).
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Parker

customer_reviews.title: Execellent sound, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are very comfortable and sound great. I may never use my in-ears again unless I need to travel really light. I do wish the cord was longer because an extension cord only works with the plain cord and not the one with the volume control. These will not replace your top of the line headphones, but when you need portability these would be hard to beat at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: K. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very light, and very rich sound
customer_reviews.text: In all honesty the over- ear model of these headphones is probably a little better with the bass and noise isolation. While I bought this as gift for someone, the recipient has loved these headphones for the past 13 months. Definitely worth more than the $70 I paid for these. On-ear model.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I think the quality of these headphones are absolutely wonderful. My only concern is that fact that they are a bit tight on my head (I could just have a large head). I tried on, just out of comfort curiosity, a pair of over-the-ear Beats in a store and I have to admit that they were much more comfortable to me. If you have any qualms about these headphones being slightly uncomfortable because they may be tight, I would suggest the Sennheiser Over-Ear headphones. Otherwise, if you just jam to your music, the uncomfortable feeling goes away and you just hear the lovely quality streaming through!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M Walker

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones. Since they are on ear, there is significant leakage of sound, so I usually don't use them around others. They were also really uncomfortable for the first few months. My ears would hurt after wearing them for just a short amount of time. I stuck with using them and they don't hurt anymore. They are very stylish and are holding up well. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Below Typical Sennheiser Performance
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not worth the price. These sound like they were made to compete with Dre Beats. The sound quality is awful compared to similarly priced headphones from Sennheiser and other manufacturers. Save yourself some money and buy one of the Sennheiser HD400 or HD500 headphones.
customer_reviews.author: 808person

customer_reviews.title: OMG !!!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG !!!! these are the best sounding headphones ever!!!! they are small, light, and sound perfect. the only thing that could improve on these is that it does not come with a cable that has inline volume control for android [fire tablet 6 hd] or samsung galaxy. had to buy that seperate for 30$. also got a pair for my mom, will report later as to HOW MUCH she loves them, as i do.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Zwick

customer_reviews.title: Bend them!
customer_reviews.text: Being able to bend the metal headband into whatever shape is comfortable it clutch. Particularly twisting (bending occurs at the slot between the earbud track and the padding) to get the ear pads to fit on ears that aren't parallel. I might have gotten over-ear headphones if they weren't so much more expensive, but these on ear sound great, are comfortable enough, and don't make me completely unaware of everything around me. It was ear opening to realize that recorded music places vocals and different instruments in different places and that you can hear each line clearly with sufficiently accurate reproduction.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, as uncomfortable as all on-ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound amazing and are made with premium materials that make them as comfortable as possible. However, these are the headphones that made me realize that my ears are simply not meant for on-ear headphones. I purchased these when they were on such a good sale that I couldn't let myself pass them up but have since been disappointed by the pain on my ears after long sessions of listening with them.
customer_reviews.author: Cole H.

customer_reviews.title: Senn sound is nice, generally
customer_reviews.text: Met my expectations for the price it was offered. Senn sound is nice, generally, but this one presents a headphone with less plastic, which makes for an even more classy look and feel. Like the durable, molded carry case, as opposed to a plastic bag. Would buy it again, but I wouldn't pay more than $100 for these, especially since it is Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: RUSSELL JONES

customer_reviews.title: Excellent over-the-ear cans
customer_reviews.text: Excellent over-the-ear cans. Very good range of tones and clean, full bass. I've very happy with this headphone. The "2.0" version of this product is the same, except they fold, which isn't a feature I find desirable. I'm really glad I went with these, instead.
customer_reviews.author: BenL

customer_reviews.title: Can't belive what I've been missing.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality. You may need to adjust your EQ or select a different sound field, depending on your preference. As other Reviews have noted, you can flex the metal bands if they are to tight. If you are accustomed to high end audio, they may not do anything for you. As an average Joe, I can't believe what I've been missing.
customer_reviews.author: rcless90mm

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound, a lot of people complain about it ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound, a lot of people complain about it hurting their ears and it does a little the first few times, but after a while your ears get used to it and it sounds and feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: These are by far the best headphones I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best headphones I have ever had. I'm hearing impaired, & also wear hearing aids in both ears. These headphones work perfectly with or without aids, & better than the more expensive brands out there. They are much more comfortable on my ears also, & the sound is concert grade. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Andrusko

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones. I got the green because I only use them for my home computer and they were cheaper than the other colors. The cushiony ear pieces are nice but i wouldnt recommend for any athletic activity. The sound quality is great. Love that headphones come with different cords/ adapters that easily interchangeable.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas F.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Loved the Discount for "Off-Colors"--black, pink etc. Nice sound, although it seems Senneheiser created these to compete with Beats so they emphasize bass to much for my taste. I can also see why some say they hurt because they do fit tightly. Again, I am happy with purchase because of 50% discount for buying black. I wish the over-the-ears Momentums were discounted like these on-the-ear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen With a PH

customer_reviews.title: Sound great after break-in.
customer_reviews.text: I spent around 48 hours of continuous music playing on these headphones to break them in. I know some people don't think that breaking in does anything, but honestly for me it does. At first these didn't sound any better than my $40 Airport bought Sony headphones. But now, oh man, they sound great. Definitely got my moneys worth.
customer_reviews.author: Rayman

customer_reviews.title: Sound is beautiful. Aesthetically beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Sound is beautiful. Aesthetically beautiful. I had a bit of a big head and was having trouble with the width of the headphones until I realized that I needed to better adjust the ear pieces to line up with my ear. Took a lot of pressure off my ears and don't have that problem anymore. I get compliments on this ALL THE TIME. And they feel so luxe
customer_reviews.author: Justine

customer_reviews.title: Great price and a great product
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones for a moderate price. I was looking for something that would carry decent sound without breaking the bank. These fit the bill perfectly. They are very comfortable and really work well. They also come with a nice travel case that was an added bonus. Don't get suckered into those Beats headphones for 3x the price..
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Aardvark

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This headphones are fantastic...excellent fit, look and weight. The most important they sound awesome. I heard a lot of progressive metal and these cans get deep double bass drum and very high keys and guitar licks. They help get the music as it is intended. Great sound and fit. Many people come to my cube and say...Hey awesome headphones...cause they do look great too !! The whole package ! Recommended 100%
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrific! Clean
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrific! Clean, clearly detailed sound with full, but not overwhelming, bass. Yes, the construction could be more solid, but when the sound is this fabulous, it's hard to carp. I was introduced to Sennheiser phones 40 years ago and have yet to switch.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Hartsfeld

customer_reviews.title: Great product except that the jack that plugs into the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product except that the jack that plugs into the headset is tricky to put in. And if it's bot put in exactly right, you have muffled sound on one or both ear pieces. Other than that, this headphone is great.
customer_reviews.author: Lamik

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for mobile devices
customer_reviews.text: Solid headphones, especially for mobile devices. Warm, well-rounded sound with just enough bass oomph along with good detail at the high end. Only issue is comfort, as they clamp on pretty tight and cause a lot of pain when wearing them with glasses. I hope that they'll stretch a bit and become more comfortable with time.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, tight fit
customer_reviews.text: These sound great, but as others have said, they're pretty tight. The earpieces are fabric, not leather, and super-comfortable, which mostly offsets the tightness problem, but not entirely. I'd buy them again though.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Bad comfort, okay sound
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: - Comfort level is bad. The pressure against the upper part of your outer ear makes you have to readjust them frequently. - Sound profile is incomplete vs the over ear versions. CNET is pretty accurate when they describe this as about 80% complete vs the over ears. I might have kept these at $100, but I decided to pay $200 and keep the over ears.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Now that everything sounds perfect, I don't know what to do
customer_reviews.text: Now that everything sounds perfect, I don't know what to do. I've watched again my favorite movies, a few episodes of great TV shows, playlists I've decided to ride with to Armageddon, and nothing sounds as it did with those twenty dollar Sony on-ear headphones. Everything sounds so much clearer, that's all. I'm sure there's some way to compare these headphones with my first naive purchase, but as a particle physicist, I just can't figure it out. Cheers, Sennheiser, these are brilliant. And a bit small for the head of a 6'2" man, but it's hackable and worth the hacking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well crafted, great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Feel very comfortable on the ear, you will often find yourself touch the headphones, to feel the soft material they're made of. The sound quality it's awesome, very clear and we'll balanced; don't expect to get extra bass as on the Beats. The only downsides are the fact that the sound leaks to the exterior, so if you are at the office, you need to be moderate with the volume to keep peace with your coworkers, and the cables, I broke one of them at the 3rd day upon getting the headphones, I've been using the replacement cable, the one without the microphone and volume control, since then.
customer_reviews.author: Horacio Chagas

customer_reviews.title: FOR ME THE SOUND IS PERFECTION!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these!!! I wear them all day at work. I did have a little soreness on my right ear the first day. But I put a slight bend in the top band. Now PERFECTION. they have awesome sound and block out my chatty co workers. The price was unbelievable. I must have gotten lucky and got these on sale. $80.00. I say I got a bargain!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Turner

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, I use them with an iPod classic and I rip my music lossless. The sound is crisp and clear, I noticed subtleties in the sound that I had not noticed before with the standard earbuds. After two hours of listening the pressure from the headphones started to get a bit too much, maybe that will get better over time
customer_reviews.author: Dutch Delight

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and look
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and look. They are lightweight and pretty sturdy. My reason for not giving them a full 5-stars is that they are uncomfortable to wear for more than 30-45 minutes (at least compared to the PXC-450s and the HD-280s). Overall I definitely recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: abelian

customer_reviews.title: they do a good job of enabling you to hear music despite the ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphone are gorgeous. They are well designed from an aesthetic POV and from a sound POV. I wear them on the plane and while they are not noise cancelling, they do a good job of enabling you to hear music despite the engine noise. The microphone is a huge plus and works very well.
customer_reviews.author: .pc

customer_reviews.title: Love them!  Pray for me that I don't lose these at the airport ... RIP - countless other headphones
customer_reviews.text: If you can get these for less than $100 and your head is smaller than a watermelon, BINGO! Comfortable - Check Sounds like [Insert your favorite attractive artist] serenading you - Check Have you bought them yet? Stop reading this and click add to cart. These headphones sound so good they would force Charles Krauthammer to break dance!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product for the money. Bought this for my daughter and She loves it. Very well made and the sound is awesome. Comes in a nice package that allows you to keep your headphones safe. The color is a soft pink and perfect for any special female in your life.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lazzaretti

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shipping and great product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Headphones i love them! I wasn't sure they would be as good as what i had read about the full size Momentum.. Fast Shipping and great product!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Fontes

customer_reviews.title: Really nice headphones with great sound and a measure of style
customer_reviews.text: Really nice headphones with great sound and a measure of style. Not overly obnoxiously bulky but still solid. I'm not an audiophile, so can't say how certain tones come through, but I can say that as headphone sound goes, everything comes through clear and you don't miss any elements of the music.
customer_reviews.author: Harlan

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I like the comfort of these headphones. They are not as heavy or tight on my head like some other brands. Sound is clear. Mostly I've been using them to listen to audiobooks on the airplane. They also sound great with music.
customer_reviews.author: ee

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound, but may have a piece break.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have a great overall sound. I find them to be both comfortable and stylish while also giving decent sound quality. Unfortunately, my pair had the white plastic piece that holds the earphone to the metal slider break and now one side cannot be adjusted for height. I still use them daily, but I have to use the adjuster on the other side for head/ ear positioning.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: The perfect everyday headphone
customer_reviews.text: These are my all time favorite headphones, the sound and quality is perfect. They have a really nice feel and weight but the sound is what took me by suprise. These are the best sounding headphones I've ever used, they also have very little sound leak
customer_reviews.author: Tom B

customer_reviews.title: Let me tell you they are awesome and sound better than models that are in their ...
customer_reviews.text: I looked at these headphones over a year ago because i had heard about the quality of the senheiser product but never got around to picking up a set mainly because i wanted to hear for myself before investing over 250 bucks on some headphones. Since then they have come up with the newer model of this particular headphone and they had this one for a heck of a deal so i gave it a shot. Let me tell you they are awesome and sound better than models that are in their original price range. comfort and style are tops as well!
customer_reviews.author: Guy Arthur Webster

customer_reviews.title: It hurts my ears when you do it...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted love these, and boy did they sound great, but they hurt my ears after about 15 minutes. The 2.0 version of these supposedly corrected this fatal flaw but for close to $300 bucks I may never know.
customer_reviews.author: Juice Box

customer_reviews.title: Overall good except minor problems in size setting
customer_reviews.text: Overall sound quality is crisp and nice Not so hard on bass and highs but none the less you can feel the equalizer built in. Another plus side is the design; overall it looks nice with touch on the bridge One problem is, it hurts my ears after long term usage, it is a common problem for on ear headphones, but this one tightens up quite harshly. - if you have overall average sized head and long term usage, I would rather recommend over ears.
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was outstanding. Comes with a bag that looks of good quality. One downside is the pressure on the ears is a bit strong. Wore them for an hour and was fine but I could see them hurting a bit if worn any longer. Color is a nice, dark red. Very attractive. These are not noise canceling headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great sound.  Big bass.  A little tight.
customer_reviews.text: These sound terrific for the price I paid on Amazon. Surprisingly bass-heavy, but not in a overwhelming Beats-like way. Great mids and highs. Super looks with he brown leather headpiece and the cream ear cups. Retro but modern at the same time. Only complaint is that they squeeze m head a bit to tightly, so after an hour or so it gets uncomfortable. I can probably fix this by fiddling with the metal arms that hold the ear cups, but have not tried yet. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, then started breaking.
customer_reviews.text: These were fantastic at first! Now the left ear goes out and is very temperamental when it does work. I am concerned that they will stop working altogether soon. These were WAAAAAY too expensive to last only two months.I will be seeking a refund/replacement.
customer_reviews.author: LeBrom

customer_reviews.title: Audio drive imbalance. When I attempted to fix left ear cup completely stopped functioning.
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased a pair of these headphones refurbished from a SportsBarn. When I first tested them noticed significate audio driver imbalance with the right ear cup was louder than the left. When I attempted to adjust the connection the left ear completely stopped producing audio. Now the left ear cup does not function at all. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: craig hoagland

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Fit, Finish and Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding headphones at this price point. Very high quality and fit well against the ear without discomfort. Love the green color and stainless steel headband. Love these for my morning commute on public transit due to low sound bleeding even at high volume levels.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R.

product_meta.title: Sennheiser Momentum On-Ear Headphone - Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingMOMENTUM On-Ear. Stunning sound and sensational style. Beautiful and compact, the MOMENTUM On-Ear embodies the style and substance of Sennheiser's critically acclaimed MOMENTUM headphones in a smaller, lighter, refreshingly fashionable approach. Designed specifically for use with phones, tablets and laptops, MOMENTUM On-Ear is the perfect choice for "on the go" music enthusiasts seeking superb sound quality. MOMENTUM On-Ear employs precision 18-ohm transducers using powerful neodymium magnets. They deliver exceptional detail, superb dynamics and solid bass response. The smooth frequency response has a slightly elevated emphasis in the bass, delivering a full bodied, warm sound. The ear cushions and stainless steel headband are covered in luxurious Alcantara, for exceptional wearing comfort for long listening sessions. MOMENTUM On-Ear is available in a range of fresh pastel and traditional colors carefully selected by an international team of fashion designers. MOMENTUM On-Ear will complement your sense of style while making a statement about your passion for sound quality.
feature_bullets: Compact closed back, over-ear design isolates ambient noise to maximize musical enjoyment..Connectivity Technology: Wired
Headband and layered foam ear pads are covered with supersoft, breathable and durable Alcantara providing comfort and a perfect fit.
18-ohm operating impedance produces outstanding bass response, dynamics and overall output level with portable audio devices
One of the two included connection cables features a metal in-line three button control and microphone supporting Apple devices like iPod, iPad and iPhone.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,814 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #2,242 in On-Ear Headphones#3,893 in Over-Ear Headphones
